name: Hotel Missoni Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: If you dig deeply, you find that Edinburgh is fortunate to have a large number of excellent accomodations, but in the end I chose to split my time between the Balmoral and the Missoni...giving a taste of old-world and new-style luxury. The two hotels are really apples and oranges because they are so different in their approach...though both gave me truly top-drawer service.
reviews.title: An Excellent Alternative to the Also-Excellent Balmoral

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a terribly light sleeper but slept well at the Missoni and didn't have issues with pipe noises nor the hallway and adjacent room noises some have mentioned. Luxury here is more in terms of materials, colors, and design...and I personally appreciated the design and the quality of the electronics.
reviews.title: Fantastic Style, Friendly Service and Good Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was vast and varied, the bar packed with interesting types, and other excellent foodie options close by.
reviews.title: Bravissimo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For plush luxury and serenity the Balmoral is your best bet....For more avant-garde style and local hipsters the Missioni is the way to go. Personally, I enjoyed both and would gladly return to either.
reviews.title: Funky but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just returned from a weekend break staying here and it over delivered on our expectations. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a Suite (nice start) and it was simply fantastic. Inside the decor was funky & fashionable and the views were stunning, better than we remember from the Balmoral. The extras, such as courtesy minibar (wine, beer, coke etc) and in-room movies, were also a welcome touch. We also ate lunch in the restaurant (fixed price for 2 or 3 courses) which was good value & delicious. Lovely selections of wines too.
reviews.title: Everything but the sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Missoni is a gorgeous hotel. From our arrival to departure we received five star treatment from all the staff. The bar is fabulous; even even returned for afternoon tea there on a cold Saturday afternoon. I love Edinburgh but this time around I have to say that the hotel was the highlight of the weekend.
reviews.title: Highlight of weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am pleased with the hotel staff for there true hospitality. Its was during winter where in Edinburgh there was no hotel rooms available because of some planned conference. Really tried with the major ones in the city however when approached this hotel - I got a initial response saying "No availability" looking at my condition they tried there best and got me a room which is implausible from a customer prospective. Outstanding.
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: As the title suggests I tried this for a change as a weekly visitor to Edinburgh. I found check in very quick, the bar a great place to hang out and the hotel in great condition in a great location. The bathroom was my big disappointment and a sliding door that didn't shut properly or lock if required cld be changed. Room was extremely modern and very brightly styled. Not cost at all for relaxing in eve In the rooms but overall not bad at all!
reviews.title: Great location, great bar, great service just lacking a little coziness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: Just spent two nights at the Hotel Missoni in Edinburgh and it was simply superb.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were so helpful and polite, the place was immaculate, the rooms were so comfy, clean and inviting and the overall experience will be hard to beat.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, views, interior and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel on 30th jan for 1 night as a birthday treat for my girlfriend. The hotel is in a good location and is very clean and has decent sized rooms. sadly our experience was totally ruined by the awful service we received after leaving.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, but very poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: When i booked the hotel, the room rate was £135 for the night. A couple of days after leaving, i checked with my credit card company who confirmed my room rate of £135 was taken however the hotel missoni had then taken an extra £235?
reviews.title: Very poor service & staff need training up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought it was maybe a small error, however upon calling the hotel i was informed that my £100 would be back on my card soon....The staff hadn't bothered to listen when i mentioned it was £235, i corrected the man and was put on hold for another couple of mins only to be told that my £235 would be back soon.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I called after these "couple of days" and was told that the hotel take your room rate and and extra £100 "just in case" you get any food to your room...they dont inform you of this when you check in. I found this a little cheeky!
reviews.title: good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had to get the hotel to ring mastercard as they couldn't be bothered and their favourite line seemed to be a couple of days.
reviews.title: Stunning Service, Lovely Location, Perfect In Every Way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Spectacular views over Scotlands capitalcity and the country around. Fantastic and mystique atmosphere all over the city of Edinburgh,polite,warm,and friendly people willing to help/inform visitors.
reviews.title: Marvelous Scotland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Must see EGG Island.Must visit the Highlands.
reviews.title: Stylish and classy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Botanic gardens,Edinburgh Castle.
reviews.title: Location location location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely tour by "HIGHLAND EXPERIENCE TOURS" friendly staff
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: especially our guide/driver Steve.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

description: Edinburgh's most comfortable, fashionable and enjoyable hotel. At the corner of George IV Bridge & the Royal Mile, just steps from Edinburgh Castle, Hotel Missoni is in the heart of Edinburgh. This gives the bedrooms breathtaking views over the Royal Mile, Edinburgh’s historic Old Town, Arthur’s Seat and even on to and across the Firth of Forth. A hotel first. Style, luxury and design are blended to create an atmosphere of comfort and elegance. The unmistakable Missoni prints mix with the work of designers such as Marcel Wandes, Eero Saarinen, Arne Jacobson and Charles Rennie Mackintosh. The heart of Hotel Missoni Edinburgh is our restaurant Cucina. Head chef, Mattia Camorani, a former protégé of renowned chef Giorgio Locatelli, creates dishes with a light modern touch, robust and hearty flavours or subtle nuanced combinations. From homemade gnocchi with a venison ‘battuto al coltello’ to our signature dessert, tiramisu. Meals are complimented by a carefully selected wine list, chosen for their interest and drinkability, to suit your meal and your mood. Bar Missoni fuses high fashion and expert cocktails. Classics perfectly mixed & new favourites designed by us. The best Italian coffee in Edinburgh & the world famous Vestri hot chocolate, exclusive to us. Also available is the Italian take on the traditional afternoon tea, focaccia sandwiches and delicate Italian cakes all homemade by the award winning team. The place in Edinburgh to see and be seen. Let the Missoni treat you to some genuine Italian luxury. Here, life is beautiful.
